info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:37AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WATERSPOUT OFF THE COAST OF FOLLY BEACH and SULLIVANS ISLAND... At 935 AM EDT...trained weather spotters reported a waterspout just offshore of Folly Beach, driving west. Another waterspout may be occurring near Sullivans Island. Both may drift onshore as a brief tornado. HAZARD...Waterspout. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...There is a slight chance that the waterspout could move onshore as a very brief tornado. Light objects such as lawn furniture could become airborne if this occurs. Minor tree damage is possible. Some coastal locations that could be impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Fort Sumter, Downtown Charleston, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Price Inlet and Capers Inlet. WATERSPOUT...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Waterspouts that move onshore become tornadoes. A tornado warning may be needed shortly if confidence in the waterspout moving onshore increases. Be prepared to take quick action if the waterspout approaches your location. Move to an interior room and away from windows.
